data.title: Places To Visit In Switzerland In Winter 2024 For A Thrilling Experience
data.meta_description: Discover places to visit in Switzerland in winter 2024.1. The Jungfrau Region 2. Zermatt 3. St. Moritz 4. Oberalp Pass Via Glacier Express, and more.
data.text:
No wonder there are scores of places to visit in Switzerland in winter and snow activities to indulge in. The vacationing charm manifolds when the Alpine air echoes with the clinks of church bells and cowbells. When the air is crisp, and the ground is white, Switzerland turns all the more fascinating. Nature’s masterpiece, this small country is blessed with jaw-dropping scenery that turns exotic in winter. Whether you enjoy winter sports or simply prefer to relax, you will be bowled over by its charm and fall in love with it repeatedly. Thanks to its efficient Swiss transport system, you can easily reach most top sites through trains, ferries, and cable cars. So, ready for a holiday but still wondering where to go in Switzerland in winter? Here are the best places you should not miss on your Switzerland winter vacation!

24 Best Places To Visit In Switzerland In Winter

If you are planning a winter vacation with your spouse or family, here is a list of top places to visit in Switzerland in winter where you should spend your holidays. The season casts magical spells on these beautiful destinations, turning them into real winter wonderlands.

1. The Jungfrau Region – For Fresh Mountain Air

Image Source: Facebook

Visiting Switzerland in December? Inhale the fresh mountain air at this breathtaking destination. The best bet to enjoy winter holidays in Switzerland, the Jungfrau Region’s splendid scenery will surely leave you spellbound. Peaks of the lofty mountains – the Jungfrau, Monch, and Eiger are coated with milky white snow and present a beautiful contrast to emerald valleys in the Alpine paradise.

In addition to scenic pleasures, your trip to this region brings you some natural wonders. These wonders include the Jungfraujoch, a col between the Jungfrau and the Mönch, which has Europe’s highest railway station, and the Aletsch Glacier, the largest glacier in Europe. It is one of the must-visit places in Switzerland in winter for non-skiers.

Tourist Attractions: Aletsch Glacier, Lauterbrunnen Village

Places To Stay: Club Med Wengen, The Onya Resort & spa, Hapimag resort

How To Reach: The nearest airport is Zurich International Airport

2. Zermatt – For The Best Skiing

Image Source: Facebook

The small town of Zermatt is a special treat for skiers and snowboarders seeking a genuine quiet stay during winter in Switzerland. Cable cars paddle skiers up surrounding mountains, making it among Europe’s best winter honeymoon destinations. You can reach the town via scenic train routes that connect it with the outside world. When illuminated, the town transforms into a picture-perfect Christmas postcard that is bound to make your winter holidays in Switzerland extra special.

The most famous peak in the Alps, the Matterhorn, stands here. Mountaineers flock to this town to conquer this technically difficult peak. If you don’t want to indulge in adventurous games, enjoy the town’s energetic nightlife instead!

Tourist Attractions: Matterhorn, Gornergrat, Klein Matterhorn

Places To Stay: Cervo mountain boutique resort, Hotel Alex, Riffelalp resort

How To Reach: Zurich International Airport is the nearest airport

3. St. Moritz – For The Best Nightlife

Image Source: Facebook

St. Moritz, the numero uno Alpine winter holiday destination, spoils you with unique leisure and sports choices and shopping opportunities. This well-groomed resort town has been a venue for two Winter Olympics. Take the most interesting of Switzerland winter tours to St. Moritz.

In December, St. Moritz is a celebrated playground for winter sports in Switzerland. The town offers skiing, snowboarding, and snowshoe trekking. St. Moritz’s mineral springs have also enhanced its popularity among travellers. To add a cherry to the cake, the town is also a hub of happening nightlife.

Tourist Attractions: Lake Saint Moritz, Corviglia, Piz Nair

Places To Stay: Grand Hotel Des Bains, Badrutt’s Palace Hotel, Kulm Hotel

How To Reach: Take the famous Glacier Express

Suggested Read: Best Places To Visit In Canada In Winter

4. Oberalp Pass Via Glacier Express – For Beautiful Views

Image Source: Facebook

This is one of the best places to vacation in February in Switzerland. Visiting Switzerland and missing out on the special trip to Oberalp Pass is a no-no. You can ride the Furka-Oberalp railway, which operates throughout the year and provides limited access through the reservation.

Or you can simply ditch the hassles and relish its view while riding the Glacier Express – a direct train that takes you from Zermatt to St. Moritz. En route, the train ride presents incredible views of the Alps while squeezing its way through tight curves, 291 bridges, narrow valleys, and 91 tunnels. Riding this train for incredible scenery is among the best things to do in Switzerland in winter. The special touch is imparted by snow on the Oberalp Pass and snowy valleys.

Why Visit: The most adventurous train ride

Tourist Attractions: Gemsstock, Gotthard Tunnel

How To Reach: The nearest airport is in Lucerne

5. Mt. Pilatus – For Adventurers

Image Source: Facebook

Perched adjacent to the city of Lucerne, Mt. Pilatus is a 2,120-meter-tall mountain that magnetizes tourists to delight in the marvellous scenery of the Swiss Alps. You can easily reach here via a cable car while enjoying the exhilarating views.

At this spectacular venue, you can delight in the charismatic views around you and take several trails for remarkable winter walks. For an enhanced Swiss vacation experience, you must add this destination to your list of places to visit in Switzerland in the winter.

Tourist Attractions: Tomlishorn Peak

Places To Stay: Hotel Bellevue, Seehotel Pilatus

How To Reach: The nearest airport is in Lucerne.

Suggested Read: Honeymoon In Switzerland

6. St. Gallen – Old World Charm

Image Source: Facebook

St Gallen is a sprightly addition to any list of Switzerland attractions one must visit in winter. But visit it during Christmas time for maximum holiday spree. The old town presents beautiful scenery with centuries-old houses, car-free and snow-covered streets, and a lively atmosphere oozing festive fervour!

The place is home to the tallest Christmas tree in Switzerland, illuminated by 5,000+ lights during the Christmas season. Get bewitched by a dazzling Christmas tree in front of the impressive Abbey of St Gallen & manifold your Christmas charisma, humming carols and savouring free glühwein (mulled wine)! This is one of the best places to visit in Switzerland in winter.

Tourist Attractions: Abbey Library of Saint Gall, St. Gallen Cathedral

Places To Stay: Einstein St Gallen, Hotel Walhalla, Hotel Dom

How To Reach: Euroairport is the nearest airport. From there you can go by road.

7. Lucerne – Picture-Perfect Views

Image Source: Facebook

Sitting picture-perfect on Lake Lucerne with the backdrop of a lovely Alps panorama, Lake Lucerne Region dons a spectacular blanket of fluffy snow in winter. Listed among the unmissable Swiss attractions in winter, the region is a wonderland that attracts snow-savvy skiers and snowboarders. This is one of the best places to visit in Switzerland in December. Couples and families can enjoy it. The region’s beauty captivates the heart and the soul as you take up splendid winter walks and snowshoe treks here.

Tourist Attractions: Chapel Bridge, Lion Monument, Swiss Museum Of Transport

Places To Stay: Radisson Blu Hotel, Renaissance Hotel, Ameron Hotel

How To Reach: The nearest airport is Zurich. From the airport, you can take a train or go by road.

Suggested Read: Best Places To Spend Christmas In Europe

8. Interlaken – A Charming Resort Town

Image Source: Facebook

A traditional resort town, Interlaken is nestled on a tapered stretch of valley. Presided over by the three mighty mountains, the Eiger, Mönch and Jungfrau, the town is distinguished for its extraordinary mountain scenery. If you plan to visit Switzerland in winter, add this destination to your list of places to visit.

Owing to its over 45 mountain railways, cable cars, alpine meadows and glaciers, skiing, and hiking trails, Interlaken is considered the adventure capital of this beautiful country. In December, it is where you can indulge in the most exhilarating things to do in Switzerland.

Tourist Attractions: Harder Kulm, Interlaken Ost, Hoheweg

Places To Stay: Hotel Interlaken, Hotel Bellevue, India village

How To Reach: The nearest airport is Zurich.

9. Davos – Highest Town In The Alps

Image Source: Facebook

A destination of superlatives, Davos is the highest town in the Alps and a high-altitude health resort. The town is also known for offering myriad opportunities to enjoy winter sports in Switzerland.

At the heart of this town, tourists can entertain themselves with a broad array of shopping choices, options for redefined dining, and cosy accommodations. In addition to that, the town has a plethora of options for after-sunset parties with its range of casinos, bars, and discotheques.

Tourist Attractions: Parsenn, Landwasser Viaduct, Fluela Park

Places To Stay: Parsenn resort, Hotel Schatzalp, Intercontinental Davos

How To Reach: You can reach here via road or rent a taxi

Suggested Read: Honeymoon Places In Switzerland

10. Arosa – Snowy Landscapes

Image Source: Facebook

Still looking for places to see in Switzerland in winter? Standing at the end of the dreamy Schanfigg Valley, Arosa is among the coolest places to visit in Switzerland in January or any winter month. Its fascinating mountain peaks and snowy landscapes draw adventure enthusiasts for extended hiking tours. In addition, the town offers a wonderful variety of snow sports and activities to help you indulge in snow play. It is one of the most beautiful in Switzerland in winter, and you should stay for a while. The place is home to the best ski resorts in Switzerland!

Tourist Attractions: Landwasser Viaduct, Parpanor Rothorn

Places To Stay: Priva Alpine Lodge, Soleval, Arosa ski resort

How To Reach: Once you reach Zurich International Airport, you can take a train or go by road.

11. Lake Geneva – Jaw-Dropping Views

Image Source: Facebook

Lake Geneva, the largest Alpine lake, is one of the most popular places to visit in Switzerland. Surrounded by stunning snow-capped peaks, Lake Geneva offers panoramic views of the Swiss Alps! The lake is surrounded by numerous Promenades, gardens, and parks, allowing you to have peaceful family time amidst the serene ambience. This is amongst the best places to visit in Switzerland in January.

Tourist Attractions: Big Foot Beach State Park, Tristan Christ Magic Theatre, Geneva Lake Museum

Places To Stay: Hotel Villa Toscane, Grand Hotel Suisse Majestic

How To Reach: The best way to reach is by bus

Suggested Read: Places To Visit In Switzerland In June

12. Chateau De Chillon – For Artists

Image Source: Facebook

Are you visiting Switzerland in January? Chateau de Chillon is located on the shores of Lake Geneva and has inspired artists and writers for centuries. It was constructed in the 12th century and comprises nearly 25 buildings. The prime attractions of Chateau de Chillon are the Great Halls, the Gothic underground rooms, the Chapel, paintings of the 14th century, and the Camera Domini. This is one of the best places to visit in Switzerland in winter.

Tourist Attractions: Golden Pass Railway, Rochers de Naye

Places To Stay: Le Coucou, Hotel Residence Bristol

How To Reach: The best way to reach is by boat. You can take a boat from Vevey or Montreux.

13. Swiss Grand Canyon – For Rafting

Image Source: Facebook

The Swiss Grand Canyon offers everything from beautiful views to adventurous activities. It is one of the best places to visit in Switzerland in winter. While the gorge looks amazingly charming with its meadows and lush greenery, it is a treat to the eyes during the winter season. In the later months, like October and November, you can go rafting and even kayaking there.

Tourist Attractions: Rhine River

Places To Stay: Hotel Cresta, The Hide Hotel Flims, Ruinaulta

How to get there: You can get there by train from Zurich. The train takes 1h50m to reach Flims Waldhaus. From there, you can trek to the canyon 3.5 km away.

Suggested Read: Restaurants In Zurich

14. The Abbey Of St Gall – For History Lovers

Image Source: Facebook

A UNESCO World Heritage site, the Abbey of St Gall, should not be missed while visiting Switzerland in winter. The site contains a very old library that will fascinate the traveller in you. The structure of the Abbey is a sight to behold, having stood there since the 8th century. It is one of the top places to visit in Switzerland in winter.

Tourist Attractions: Abbey Library of Saint Gall, St. Gallen Cathedral, Wildlife Park Peter and Paul

Places to stay: Touched City Apartments, Hotel Vadian, Hotel Dom

How to reach: You can take a bus or train from Lucerne to the abbey.

15. The Castles Of Bellinzona – Magnificence At Its Best

Image Credit: JoachimKohler-HB for Wikimedia Commons

If you are fond of castles, you must visit the three castles of Bellinzona during winter in Switzerland. The castles, namely, The Castelgrande, Castello Montebello and Castello Sasso Corbaro, stand proudly and offer a majestic view. The castles are the emblems of royalty and grandeur of the city. You will be taking several steps back in time while visiting the castles. Do not forget to bring your camera along.

Tourist Attractions: Bellinzona Market Town, 3 castles – Castelgrande, Montebello and Sasso Corbaro

Places to stay: Hotel Unione, Ostillo Bellinzona, Villa Del Gusto

How to reach: The best way to reach here is by train. Take a train to Bellinzona. Once you reach there, you can walk to the castles or take a bus there.

Suggested Read: Canyoning In Switzerland

16. Lugano- Home To A Glacial Lake

Image Credit: JensPeter for Pixabay

Lugano is one of the most interesting places to experience winter in Switzerland. Located in the Ticino region of Southern Switzerland, this charming town settlement encircles a glacial lake, Laguna Lake. This place has a mix of Swiss-Mediterranean cultures, which can be experienced through its cuisine and architecture. Lugano city sits amidst mountains that accentuate the landscape. Piazza Della Riforma and Lugano Lake are some of the best places to visit.

Tourist Attractions: Lake Laguno, Villa Del Balbianello, Monte San Salvatore

Places to stay: Hotel Splendid Royal Lugano, Hotel Villa Principe Leopoldo & Spa

How to reach: Lugano has a regional airport with flights connecting to other major cities, including Geneva, Zurich, Cagliari, Sion, and Olbia.

17. Zurich – A Medieval Town

Image Source: Shutterstock

Zurich is one of the most popular cities for Switzerland holidays. It is located in the country’s Northern region, occupying the north end of Lake Zurich. This city is a beautiful fusion of old and new harmoniously. It is a financial centre of Switzerland but has several locations dating back to the medieval era. Limmatquai and 17th-century Town Hall – Rathaus are some of the major attractions in Zurich. If you are spending 3 days in Switzerland in winter, make sure to witness the best of Zurich.

Tourist Attractions: Grossmunster, Fraumunster Church, Banhhofstrasse

Places to stay: Zurich Marriott Hotel, Crown Plaza Zurich

How to reach: Zurich Airport is one of the major airports in Switzerland

Suggested Read: Hang Gliding In Switzerland

18. Swiss National Park -Snow Mountains

Image Credit: Daniel Schwen for Wikipedia

The gorgeous Swiss National Park spans the Western Rhaetian Alps in eastern Switzerland. The park has been recognized as a World UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. Swizz National Park is one of the best places to experience Switzerland’s winter. The verdant mountains are covered in a thick carpet of snow during the cold season.

Tourist Attractions: Engadin, Soul

Places to stay: Hotel Park Naziunal II Fuorn, Hotel Crusch Alba

How to reach: The best way to reach Swiss National Park is by boarding a train from Zurich to Zernez.

19. Wengen

Image Source: Facebook

Transforming into a winter wonderland, Wengen village offers over-the-top skiing and snowboarding opportunities on the Jungfrau Region’s slopes. The car-free status adds to its scenic and peaceful atmosphere, perfect for sledging and winter walks. Furthermore, the town’s charming streets and traditional chalets become more enchanting with festive lights and decorations during Christmas. You can even enjoy hiking trails and ice rinks, experiencing the best Swiss winter vibes. Hence, whether you are with your friends, family, or a partner, every second spent in this paradise is truly memorable.

Tourist Attractions: Jungfraujoch, Mannlichen, Lauterbrunnen Valley, Schilthorn

Places To Stay: Hotel Alpenruhe, Hotel Schonegg, Hotel Jungfrau, Wengen Youth Hostel

How To Reach: The nearest airport is Zurich Airport, and one can self-drive by car.

Suggested Read: 3 Days In Switzerland

20. Saas-Fee

Image Source: Facebook

Nestled in the Swiss Alps, Saas-Fee is a car-free village renowned for its year-round glacier skating. It is known as the ‘Pearl of the Alps’, and offers a range of adrenaline-fueled activities, including climbing and hiking. To unleash your inner adventurer, remember to explore hiking trails. These are for all hikers, from beginners to pros, like the ‘Five Lakes Walk’, which offers jaw-dropping views of the lake and the Alps. Furthermore, you can enjoy scenic rides on distinct cable cars and gondolas, like the Metro Alpin. As captivating peaks, like the Allalinhorn, surround the village, Saas-Fee exudes magical and ecstatic vibes. Overall, this offbeat place is among the extraordinary snow places in Switzerland.

Tourist Attractions: Saas-Fee Glacier, Allalinhorn, Ize Pavilion, Saastal Museum

Places To Stay: Hotel Mattmarkblick. Hotel Schweizerhof, Hotel Saaserhof, Airbnb

How To Reach: By train, car, and plane

21. Jura Vaudois Nature Park

Image Source: Facebook

Step into a haven where scenic landscapes, a tranquil ambience, and many adventurous activities take your mind off your daily chores. The Nature Park is a stunning natural area in the Swiss canton of Vaud, perfect for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts. Here, you can enjoy witnessing wildlife, hiking, and exploring lush forests. This park leaves a lasting impression on all travellers, as the vistas and charming villages offer something for all. Remember to explore historic sites like Chateau de Vallorbe, as it takes you to the rich era of the city.

Tourist Attractions: Mount Tendre, Lac de Joux, Gorges de l’Orbe, Chateau de Vallorbe

Places To Stay: Hotel du Lac, Auberge du Chalet des Enfants, Hotel de Ville, Airbnb

How To Reach: Train, local bus/taxi, Drive by car, plane

Suggested Read: Wildlife In Switzerland

22.

Image Source: Facebook

A snowy paradise welcomes you to experience the scenic alpine scenery and tranquil aura. The high-altitude glacier features fantastic snowboarding and skiing opportunities year-round. As you sledge down the 6 km run or have the unique Alpine Coaster ride, you feel thrilled and excited simultaneously. When visiting Glacier 3000, remember to check out a suspension bridge- The Peak Walk, which connects two mountain peaks and offers a breathtaking landscape. So, have endless fun in this winter wonderland this year for an amazing time with loved ones.

Tourist Attractions: Peak Walk by Tissot, Snow Park, Alpine Coaster, Glacier 3000 Ski Resort

Places To Stay: Hotel des Alpes, Hotel Eurotel Victoria, Auberge de la Poste, Airbnb

How To Reach: By train, car, plane

23. Basel

Image Source: Facebook

Basel becomes a charming festive attraction in winter with its captivating Christmas vibes and cosy atmosphere. It is among the best cities in Switzerland to visit in winter for its historic architecture, misty Rhine River, and historic sites. While visiting the city during Christmas, remember to explore the famous markets- Munsterplatz and Barfusserplatx as these invite you to shop for local arts, seasonal treats, and mulled wine, to name a few. This city offers a delightful winter experience with a mix of festive cheer and cultural vibes.

Tourist Attractions: Basel Minister, Kunstmuseum Basel, Tinguely Museum, Basel Zoo

Places To Stay: Hotel Basel, Grand Hotel Les Trois Rois, Hotel Kloster Dornach

How To Reach: By train, car, and plane

Suggested Read: Street Foods In Switzerland

24.

Image Source: Facebook

This winter, embark on the famous Chateau-d’Oex, which welcomes you to engage in thrilling sports and relax. This village is famous for its annual 9-day Hot Air Balloon Festival, usually at the end of January. Additionally, you can participate in adventurous winter activities, such as winter hiking and snowshoeing. All in all, the winter allure of this village is a sight to behold. The town’s mix of festive events and winter charm makes this one of Switzerland’s best places to visit.

Tourist Attractions: Alpine Museum, Gorges du Chauderon

Places To Stay: Hotel La Poste, Auberge de la Gare, Hotel des Alpes, Camping du Chateau, Airbnb

How To Reach: By train, car, and plane

Further Read: Villages In Switzerland

Switzerland is undoubtedly unparalleled. So, are you prepared for a classic holiday to this winter wonderland? If yes, plan your trip to Switzerland and experience pure magic, whether you’re thinking of a honeymoon or a trip with family.

Frequently Asked Questions About Places To Visit In Switzerland

What is there to do in Switzerland in the winter?

There are numerous activities you can indulge in when visiting Switzerland. These include: 1. Try ice skating and skiing at St. Moritz 2. Enjoy dog sledging 3. Indulge in shopping experiences at Christmas markets 4. Witness the beauty of Swiss National Park

Which are the best places to stay in Switzerland in winter?

Some of the best places you can visit in Switzerland to witness the best of it include Zermatt, staad, Bern, Grindelwald, Zermatt, Montreux, Davos, and Villars.

Which are the places to visit in Switzerland in winter with family?

If you're wondering where to go in Switzerland in Winter with your family then, Zurich, Nendaz, Grachen, and Engelberg are among the top places to consider. These places are kid-friendly and have plenty of options in terms of accommodation, activities, and sightseeing which interests both adults and kids alike.

What are the best places to celebrate Christmas in Switzerland?

Berne, Zurich, St. Mortiz, and Zermatt are among the best places in Switzerland in winter where you can celebrate Christmas. These places are adorned with Christmas lights, and the Christmas markets make for a fun-filled extravaganza.

How many days do you need in Switzerland?

You will need at least 3 full to explore Rome, 2 days each for Florence, Siena/San Gimignano/Pisa, driving around Tuscany, Venice, and 1 day for Milan. On the whole, you need at least 6-7 days to visit the best of Switzerland.

How cold is Switzerland in December?

December is a festive month, and despite the biting cold temperature, there is so much fun guests can have while on holiday in Zurich. December is winter in Zurich, with an average temperature of 2°C (35 ̊F). The highest temperature for December is 4°C (39 ̊F) while the lowest temperature is -1°C (30 ̊F).

Where can I spend Christmas in Switzerland?

Here are a few places where you can bring in the festive season and celebrate Christmas in Switzerland: 1. St Gallen 2. Stein am Rhein 3. Einsiedeln 4. St Moritz 5. Locarno 6. Lugano
